docs.snippet:
TAMPA — While watching Mariano Rivera announce Saturday that this would be his final season, C. C. Sabathia wondered whether he, too, would one day have that privilege.
   
If he did, it would probably mean that he had performed ver...
docs.lead_paragraph:
TAMPA — While watching Mariano Rivera announce Saturday that this would be his final season, C. C. Sabathia wondered whether he, too, would one day have that privilege.
 
If he did, it would probably mean that he had performed very well for a long time, and it would be a recognition of his success. The alternative is sitting at home during long winter months, waiting for a team to call with an offer.
docs.abstract: Baseball Roundup; New York Yankees pitcher C C Sabathia comments on fellow pitcher Mariano Rivera's retirement. (M)2

docs.snippet: DUNEDIN, Fla. — With few obvious options available to replace the injured Mark Teixeira at first base, the Yankees are becoming creative in their search. They have asked the retired first baseman Derrek Lee whether he would come out of reti...
docs.lead_paragraph:
DUNEDIN, Fla. — With few obvious options available to replace the injured Mark Teixeira at first base, the Yankees are becoming creative in their search. They have asked the retired first baseman Derrek Lee whether he would come out of retirement, according to a person with knowledge of the talks who asked to remain anonymous.
 
As of Sunday night there was no deal pending, the person said, but Lee was interested and the situation could always be revisited.
docs.abstract: Baseball Roundup; New york Yankees, looking to replace injured first baseman Mark Teixeira, are in talks with retired first baseman Derrick Lee; other MLB developments noted. (M)

headline.main: Yankees Are Said To Pursue Derrek Lee

docs.snippet:
PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla. — The right-hander Frank Francisco threw off a mound Sunday morning for the first time this spring training.
   
Francisco, 33, entered camp battling inflammation in his right elbow after having bone spurs surgi...
docs.lead_paragraph:
PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla. — The right-hander Frank Francisco threw off a mound Sunday morning for the first time this spring training.
 
Francisco, 33, entered camp battling inflammation in his right elbow after having bone spurs surgically removed in December. He threw 20 pitches and was asked afterward how he felt.
docs.abstract: Baseball Roundup; New York Mets pitcher Frank Francisco, who is battling inflammation in his right elbow, takes the mound for the first time this spring. (S)
